refnamediv.refpurpose: Load and save the display backlight brightness at boot and shutdown

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: systemd-backlight@.service is a service that restores the display backlight or LED (e.g. keyboard backlight) brightness at early boot and saves it at shutdown. The brightness is stored in /var/lib/systemd/backlight/.
During loading, systemd-backlight reads ID_BACKLIGHT_CLAMP udev property, that takes a boolean value or a percentage (needs to be suffixed with %, e.g. 30%).

If the device is a display backlight, when the property is unset or set to true, the saved brightness is calmped to a value of at least 1 or 5% of the maximum brightness, whichever is greater. When a percentage is specified, the saved brightness is calmped to a value of at least 1 or the specified percentage of the maximum brightness, whichever is greater. If false, the saved brightness will not be clamped, and loaded as is.

If the device is an LED (e.g. keyboard backlight) device, when the property is unset or set to false, the saved brightness will not be clamped, and loaded as is. When set to true, the saved brightness is calmped to 5% of the maximum brightness. When a percentage is specified, the saved brightness is calmped to the specified percentage of the maximum brightness.

refsect1.title: Kernel Command Line
refsect1.para: systemd-backlight understands the following kernel command line parameter:

listitem.para: Takes a boolean argument. Defaults to 1. If 0, does not restore the backlight settings on boot. However, settings will still be stored on shutdown.
